alt.name: Soy Milk
alt.description: Widely available and versatile. It can be used in sweet and savory dishes as well as coffee.

alt.name: Oat Milk
alt.description: Great for breakfast cereals, baking and coffee. Oat Milk is healthy, cheap and easy to make at home, with only two ingredients.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 1 part oats and 2 parts water. Blend, strain and store refridgerated for up to 5 days.

alt.name: Almond Milk
alt.description: Great for breakfast cereals, baking and coffee. Almond Milk has a mild nutty flavor, is healthy and easy to make at home, with only two ingredients.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 1 part almonds and 2 parts water. Blend, strain and store refridgerated for up to 5 days.

alt.name: Cashew Milk
alt.description: Great for breakfast cereals, baking and coffee. Cashew Milk has a distinct nutty flavor, is healthy and easy to make at home, with only two ingredients.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 1 part cashews and 2 parts water. Blend, strain and store refridgerated for up to 5 days.

alt.name: Chia Egg
alt.description: Raw egg(white) consistency, great for baking, very easy to make.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 1 tbsp chia seeds, 2 tbsp water, let sit for 15minutes before use.

alt.name: Flax Egg
alt.description: Raw egg(white) consistency, very easy to make and affordable.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 1 tbsp ground fax seeds, 2 tbsp water, let sit for 15minutes before use.

alt.name: Aquafaba
alt.description: Chickpea water that can be whipped like egg white.
alt.recipe: Recipe: Whisk with a handheld mixer until fluffy.

alt.name: Chickpea Flour
alt.description: A great way to replace egg in omelettes, quiche or tarte.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 1 part chickpea flour, 2 parts nut milk or water. Mix well and add up to 4 parts vegetable stock, cook until thickened.

alt.name: Silken Tofu
alt.description: A great way to replace egg in desserts, quiche or tarte.
alt.recipe: Recipe: Blend and thin out with water if needed.

alt.name: Margerine
alt.description: Diary free margerines, made of sunflower or rapeseed oil for example, are great alternatives for cooking and baking.

alt.name: Vegan Butter
alt.description: Vegan butter is a great alternative for raw uses - like on bread.

alt.name: Coconut Cream
alt.description: Because of it's naturally high fat content, coconut cream is a great alternative for diary cream. Serve with desserts or use for cooking.
alt.recipe: Recipe: Chill a can of full-fat coconut milk until firm. Pour away the liquid and whip the remains with a handheld mixer.

alt.name: Vegan Buttermilk
alt.description: An easy to make, inexpensive and healthy alternative. Great for baking and sweet dishes like pancakes.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 250mL of nut milk, 1 tbsp of apple cider vinegar or fresh lemon juice. Let sit for 15minutes, stirring occasionally.

alt.name: Vegan Cheese
alt.description: There is a wide variety of plant-based 'cheeses', sliced or shredded, that look, taste and melt like dairy.

alt.name: Agar Agar
alt.description: Gained from algae, it has a neutral taste and the same thickening and binding properties as the bone-marrow substract gelatin. It is great for baking, jelly or candy making.

alt.name: Cashew Sour Cream
alt.description: A rich, hearty alternative - easily made and customized.
alt.recipe: Recipe: 150g cashews, soaked for 2-3hours, 2 tbsp fresh lemon juice, 1 tsp apple cider vinegar, 1 tsp garlic powder and a dash of salt. Blend and store refridgerated.
